710520f-b.title: Manhattan: 10th Avenue - 29th Street (West)
710520f-b.text:
Tenth Avenue, east side, from West 29th to 30th Streets, showing the New York Cettral Railroad's hmilk shed. This extends eastward to 9th Avenue. In 1931 this site is to be cleared
for the new U. S. Parcel Post Building.
About 1930
Views 1,2,3,4
P. L. Sperr

710521f-b.title: Manhattan: 10th Avenue - 29th Street (West)
710521f-b.text:
Tenth Avenue, at the N. E. corner of West 29th Street, showing the milk shed and yards of the New York Central Railroad. This occupies the entire block east to 9tb Avenue and extending from 29th to 30tH Streets. In 1931, this site will be cleared for the new
U. S. Parcel Post Building.
Note in the background of View 2, the Empire State Building
emerging from the horizon.
May 12, 1930
September 8, 1930
P. L. Sperr

710521f-a.title: Manhattan: 10th Avenue - 29th Street (West)
710521f-a.text:
Tenth Avenue, at the N. E. corner of West 29th Street, showing the milk shed and yards of the New York Central Railroad. This occupies the entire block east to 9tb Avenue and extending from 29th to 30tH Streets. In 1931, this site will be cleared for the new
U. S. Parcel Post Building.
Note in the background of View 2, the Empire State Building
emerging from the horizon.
May 12, 1930
September 8, 1930
P. L. Sperr

710519f-a.title: Manhattan: 10th Avenue - 29th Street (West)
710519f-a.text:
Tenth Avenue, at the N. E. corner of W. 29th Street, showing the vew York Central Railroad's milk unloading yard site being prepared for the U. S. Parcel Post Building that is to rise here. This block site extends from 10th to 9th Avenues, between 29th to 30th Streets. Vote the Empire State Building dominating the background. The white structure to the left is the recently erected Sears Roebuck and Company building at the S. E. corner of 9th Avenue and W. 31st Street. This arose concurrent with the Empire State Building.
June 2, 1931
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

710519f-b.title: Manhattan: 10th Avenue - 29th Street (West)
710519f-b.text:
Tenth Avenue, at the N. E. corner of W. 29th Street, showing the vew York Central Railroad's milk unloading yard site being prepared for the U. S. Parcel Post Building that is to rise here. This block site extends from 10th to 9th Avenues, between 29th to 30th Streets. Vote the Empire State Building dominating the background. The white structure to the left is the recently erected Sears Roebuck and Company building at the S. E. corner of 9th Avenue and W. 31st Street. This arose concurrent with the Empire State Building.
June 2, 1931
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

710517f-a.title: Manhattan: 10th Avenue - 29th Street
710517f-a.text:
Tenth Avenue at N. E. corner of 29th Street, showing at left,
excavation for Parcel Post Office.
Empire State Building in centre background.
June 2, 1931.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

710523f-b.title: Manhattan: 10th Avenue - 29th Street (West)
710523f-b.text:
Tenth Avenue, worth from W. 29th Street, showing "Railroad Avenue" and its pedestrian bridge at 30t) Street. On the right are the milk unloading yards of the New York Central Railroad. This site was later improved with the U. S. Parcel Post Building (see view 2). In the background is the Master Printers Buuilding
at 34th Street.
View 2, being later shows the new Post Office building and the elevated roadbed of the New York Central Railroad entering same. The street level has returned to civic use at this date.
This view is at 30th Street.
March 24, 1929
May 30, 1934
P. L. Sperr

710523f-a.title: Manhattan: 10th Avenue - 29th Street (West)

710522f-a.title: Manhattan: 10th Avenue - 29th Street
710522f-a.text:
(1)
Tenth Ave., east side, from 29th to 30th Streets, showing the
foundation for the Parcel Post Office site.
June 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing 30th Street, with the Ninth Ave. elevated station
in the left background.
June 2, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, including Tenth Ave. from 29th to 31st Streets, showing skeleton of the Paroel Post Office, from railroad yards at Eleventh
Avenue.
July 9, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

711944f-a.title: Manhattan: 29th Street (West) - 10th Avenue
711944f-a.text:
516-526 West 29th Street, south side, west of Tenth Avenue. No. 516 and 524 are one-story frame buildings and No. 520 is a
three-story frame building.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 217
